required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Assessing the Frequency of Lidocaine Ineffectiveness in ADHD
clinical_study.official_title: Prevalence of Lidocaine Ineffectiveness in the General Population Excluding Those With ADHD

brief_summary.textblock: This work will assess the prevalence in the ADHD of the ineffectiveness of the anesthetic Lidocaine.

detailed_description.textblock: Using a non-invasive, pain-free, taste-based approach to assess lidocaine effectiveness, the study will assess the frequency of ineffectiveness in the target population. This study will be compared with a similar assessment among the general population (NCT03676725). The controlled trial will assess the ability of lidocaine oral gel to block taste (e.g., sweet) in 40 adults, with a history of ADHD.

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: A group of 40 subjects will be assessed.
study_design_info.masking_description: The scoring of the lidocaine test is masked, using the coded identity of the tastes. The tastes will be assessed in random order. The subjects and other study personnel will be told not to discuss what the subject could or couldn't taste. Scoring will not be shared with the testing site until all testing is complete. This is one of the last studies with an IRB for each arm and site. Hence it appears to be a single arm, but the other arms are separately registered with ClinicalTrials.gov

primary_outcome.measure: Frequency of lidocaine ineffectiveness in ADHD
primary_outcome.description: Subjects will be asked to identify each taste and its intensity on a 0 (no taste) to 9 (very intense) scale.

other_outcome.measure: Comparison of frequency of lidocaine ineffectiveness in those in general population (NCT03676725)
other_outcome.description: Subjects will be asked to identify each taste and its intensity on a 0 (no taste) to 9 (very intense) scale.

arm_group.description: Subjects will be tested with lidocaine gel.

intervention.description: Septodont 5% oral lidocaine gel (NDC 0362-0221-10), 75 mg premeasured by compounding pharmacy and dispensed into blister pack

patient_data.ipd_description: The investigators plan to submit for publication descriptions of what was accomplished, and the evaluations as described in the study, including the incidence of lidocaine ineffectiveness in those with ADHD and in the general population.
